# Material Preparation

## May

- May 17th: Sakai sites and syllabi ready for review 
    -(instructors, email Cris when ready)
- May 21st: approval/comments of Sakai sites and syllabi (Cristina)

--

## Before course starts

- Send syllabus to students:
  - 15 and 7 days before your session starts
- Verify students' placement
  - Deadline for uploading students' profile: 2nd day of classes (recommended tool: Assignments)
- Prepare your whole sakai site beforehand
  - Focus on grading during the session
- Make sure your internet connection and microphone are always good

---

# First week of classes 

- 2 orientation meetings (main + make-up)
- Student agreement (on the syllabus)
- Student profile (2nd day due)
- No-show warnings (also for wiley plus)
- Form groups for their Weekly meetings

--

# During the semester

- Weekly announcements for what they have to submit 
  - You can schedule them on sakai
- Show certain degree flexibility with their technological problems 
- 48 hours to submit grades
    - Very important
- End: return textbooks to Jen

---

# General tips

- One-on-one meeting organizations:
  - Google doc
  - Doodle
  - Sakai: sign-up tool
  
--

- Put a picture and short bio of yourself in the homepage

--

- Send messages to them with general comments

--

- You cannot give access to the class to a specific student, they have to go through the office (Vivian)

---

# Student meetings

## 1st week

- Forum to organize groups:
    - Post by Thursday (recommended) your name, where you live, dates and times when you can meet (10 min per week).
    - Decide on a group leader (has to communicate the instructor the group names and time they meet)

--

- Once the groups are ready, add to the homepage:
    - Group names and time/day they meet
    - If someone cannot make it to their meeting, they can join another meeting

# Workshop 

- 4 student meetings

--

- Develop instructions for meetings

--

- Tips:
  
  - Cover content from the previous/current week
  - Open questions (they should not be scripting)

--

- Assessment:
  
  - Include this category in the gradebook (with 4 items)
  - Participation points (just for speaking Spanish)
  - Your observations: compile major comments and send them a message/video
